Class MountInfo

java.lang.Object
  MountInfo

public class MountInfo
extends Object

Finds local mount points and gives usage information.

Field Summary
 long available
          The number of bytes available on the filesystem (size - used)
 int capacityPercent
          Percent used disk space (100 * used / size)

          df -k results line pattern.
private static boolean kIsWindows
          We use the native java for Windows, since it works with drive letters but not unix mount points

          The path to the mount point
 long size
          The total size of the filesystem in bytes (used + available)

          The number of bytes currently used on the filesystem (size - available)

The path to the mount point

The total size of the filesystem in bytes (used + available)

public long used
The number of bytes currently used on the filesystem (size - available)

available

public long available
The number of bytes available on the filesystem (size - used)

capacityPercent

public int capacityPercent
Percent used disk space (100 * used / size)

kIsWindows

private static final boolean kIsWindows
We use the native java for Windows, since it works with drive letters but not unix mount points

dfLinePattern

private static Pattern dfLinePattern
df -k results line pattern.
                /dev/...
                        [size in k] [used in k] [available in k] [percent used]% /...
Allows for optional line break between device path and sizes.

Constructor Detail

MountInfo

private MountInfo(File p,
                  long s,
                  long u,
                  long a,
                  int c)
Constructor to improve usability internally.

Parameters:
p - The mount point path
s - The size of the filesystem in bytes
u - The used bytes on the filesystem
a - The available bytes on the filesystem
c - The percent capacity used on the filesystem

MountInfo

private MountInfo(File p)
           throws IOException
Constructs from a mount point path. NOTE: Should only be called on Java 1.6 (6.0) or later To compile and run under 1.5 (5.0), we dynamically look up the methods.

Parameters:
p - The root path
Throws:
IOException - If we are not Java 1.6 (6.0) or later
Method Detail

mount

public static MountInfo mount(File path)
                       throws IOException
Given a path, returns the mount point.

Parameters:
path - The path to query. Must be a path to a local filesystem. If it is a path to a networked filesystem, it may return null, or a local filesystem.
Returns:
The mount point info for that path
Throws:
IOException - if there is an io error

mounts

public static ArrayList<MountInfo> mounts()
                                   throws IOException
Gets all the known local mount points. Calls df -k, and looks for filesystems on devices from /dev.

Returns:
The list of mount points and their space information
Throws:
IOException - If there is a problem getting the mount points

_exec

private static String _exec(String... args)
                     throws IOException
Executes a shell command and returned stdout as a string. Starts the process, and reads up to 1k at a time from stdout.

Parameters:
args - The command (arg[0]) and the arguments to run
Returns:
stdout as a string
Throws:
IOException - If there is a problem

main

public static void main(String... args)
Test. Gets the mount points and displays the path, capacity, used and size.

Parameters:
args - The paths to files to determine what mount point they are on.
